item.title: Kristina add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I never met another man I'd rather be. And even if that's a delusion, it's a lucky one." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Anna Akhmatova
item.description: "You will hear thunder and remember me, And think: she wanted storms. The rim Of the sky will be the colour of hard crimson, And your heart, as it was then, will be on fire." -- Anna Akhmatova

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Jim Harrison
item.description: "Some people hear their own inner voices with great clearness. And they live by what they hear. Such people become crazy... or they become legend. " -- Jim Harrison

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "I think it is all a matter of love; the more you love a memory the stronger and stranger it becomes" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Anna Akhmatova
item.description: "Forgive me, that I manage badly, Manage badly but live gloriously, That I leave traces of myself in my songs, That I appeared to you in waking dreams." -- Anna Akhmatova

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Christian Bauman
item.description: "I write for the same reason I read: because it's all there is for me." -- Christian Bauman

item.title: Kristina add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief." -- Franz Kafka
